text.History, Examination and Investigations: Due #3 docetaxel carboplatin and phesgo #2 - G1 nausea (felt worse with dizziness from metoclopramide prn), mucositis and Upper Respiratory Tract Infection (saw CRC 11, 14 Jul) (low grade fever; cough dry, sore throat, runny nose; nonneutropenic) mild sorethroat a few days after each cycle Constipation G 1 1st few days then diarrhea from antibiotics (mild) No vomiting, rash, numbness, SOB No mucositis or acne with #2 Mild aches in neck - prn paracetamol with fever; insomnia with steroids; G1 fatigue wk2; back to normal wk3 ? mild right hand thrombophlebitis around cannulation site for #1 - given antibiotics by polyclinic - much improved - noninflamed now o/e 163cm 51.5kg mouth OK left breast 12:30 small patch of redness, no discharge or open wound, no obvious mass but prominent 2.5x2.5cm breast lump -> now just dusky discolouration above diffuse 2.5x2.5cm bilateral breasts lumpy in general No palp nodes HS dual chest clear Abd no abnormality detected A: likely clin progesterone receptor

text.DIAGNOSIS SUMMARY: Diagnosis 1: Diagnosis 1: 3290542017 : Invasive carcinoma of breast Date of Diagnosis 1: 2025-06-09 Primary Site 1: Invasive breast cancer
text.MANAGEMENT FOR THIS VISIT: Offered neoadjuvant over adjuvant docetaxel carboplatin phesgo (trastuzumab + pertuzumab) - to shrink tumor and reduce risk of relapse; will need maintenance targeted therapy after Advantage of neoadjuvant - shrink tumor, may facilitate surgery , and may tailor treatment accordingly eg T-DM1 for residual disease in resected specimen. Advantage of surgery 1st - no original T and N stage more accurately 2025-08-29 15:23  Current Location: NCC-OP Pharmacy L1 Potential AEs including alopecia, nausea vomiting, diarrhea, hyperglycaemia, mucositis, aches and pains, numbness - neuropathy, rash, hypersensitivity, decrease in blood counts, infection, chemo brain, premature menopasue, infertility, need for barrier contraception, organ damage including cardiac, leukaemia (rare, more with AC), lifethreatening complications (rare - overall benefits still greater than risks) explained; also to avoid traditional meds and alternative therapies For chemo counseling, including financial counseling ARISE form given already at KK (To consider portcath/CVC/PICC if venous access difficult - look OK now) Patient agreeable to start treatment ASAP; ICF and pt info leaflets given at KK; informed consent taken Needs FBCUECrLFTHepBsAg and echo - ATU/pharm to trace results for me, thank you book #1 docetaxel carboplatin phesgo with pegfilgrastim D2 (NCC) Seeing Preetha tomorrow Refer for genetic counseling Review on 24 Jul - FBCUECrLFT OA for #2, earlier if any problems
